remarks: There is a unique line going through any two distinct points.  Theorem 6.19 of [Schwabhauser] p. 46.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 25-May-2019.)
statement:

tglineelsb2.2 $e |- ( ph -> Q e. B ) $.
tglineelsb2.4 $e |- ( ph -> P =/= Q ) $.
tglinethrueu $p |- ( ph -> E! x e. ran L ( P e. x /\ Q e. x ) ) $.
